Params: {1: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/BgStory17.jpg'}
{1: 'Assets/Product/Effect/Prefab/FxUi/FxUiStoryNew/FxUiStoryTongxunHalfNew.prefab', 3: '1'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Asimov', 3: 'Go to this address tomorrow.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Asimov', 3: "I'll do a simple test on you first to determine the coordination and synchronization rate between your M.I.N.D. and the specialized frame.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Asimov', 3: 'Any request you have on the frame, you can tell me then.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Assets/Product/Effect/Prefab/FxUi/FxUiStoryNew/FxUiStoryTongxunHalfNew.prefab', 4: '1'}
{1: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/BgStory16.jpg'}
{1: '1', 3: 'Chrome arrives at the address Asimov sent him, reaching the classified laboratory of the Science Council.'}
{3: 'This is the first time Chrome is here. Constructs rarely have the chance to step inside the Science Council unless specifically requested by a mission.'}
{3: 'Opening the door, Chrome finds someone he has not expected.'}
{2: '???', 3: 'Have you forgotten already? I was in charge of the operation that turned you into a Construct.'}
{2: 'Chrome', 3: "Yes... Of course I remember. I'm just surprised that you remember me.", 4: '1'}
{2: '???', 3: "I remember the name of everyone I've turned into Construct."}
{2: '???', 3: 'Not to mention that you were one of my proudest works.'}
{2: '???', 3: "You're here for Asimov, aren't you? I remember him mentioning a visitor. I'm afraid he's still buried in work with the other technicians of the council."}
{2: '???', 3: 'An urgent R&D project on something called "bit domain."'}
{2: '???', 3: "So I'm doing his meet-and-greet for him until he's done with that."}
{2: 'Chrome', 3: "I'm here to submit this.", 4: '1'}
{3: "Chrome hands him the digital document he has been holding on to since the moment he left John's office."}
{2: '???', 3: 'This... is about the specialized frame.'}
{2: '???', 3: 'A very detailed proposal... and very ambitious.'}
{2: '???', 3: "Is this your father's request?"}
{2: 'Chrome', 3: 'No, it is mine.', 4: '1'}
{3: 'The researcher raises his brows, astonished, before flipping through the proposal.'}
{2: '???', 3: 'Hmm... Still a Tank-type Construct, but with a focus on advances instead of defenses, unlike your current one.'}
{2: '???', 3: 'Removing the artificial skin on the legs... Improving the cooling system, focusing on short burst capabilities, and maintaining high-speed movement... Is that really a good idea?'}
{2: '???', 3: 'I seem to remember that the first request for this frame is "to resemble a human as much as possible."'}
{2: 'Chrome', 3: 'I have explained to my father that the abilities and direction of the new frame, as well as everything related, will be determined by me.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Chrome', 3: 'Compared to non-essential aesthetics, we should focus more on optimization that benefits me on the battlefield.', 4: '1'}
{2: '???', 3: 'You might have guessed it, but I still have to explain to you what is so special about this specialized frame.'}
{2: '???', 3: "It's difficult just to adapt to it. The specialized frame will be a stressful burden to your M.I.N.D."}
{2: '???', 3: 'Even if the adaptation works, it will still take a long time of adjustment before you can properly use the frame.'}
{2: '???', 3: "It'll take a long time, and the process is extremely painful... No less than the operation that turned you into a Construct."}
{2: '???', 3: 'There is barely any research on this frame. With nothing to reference, we have no idea what problem will surface in the future.'}
{2: 'Chrome', 3: 'I will work with you on the adjustment.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Chrome', 3: "I won't be as impulsive as I was.", 4: '1'}
{2: '???', 3: "Your eyes, they're different."}
{2: '???', 3: "They're different from how they were when you were first operated."}
{2: '???', 3: 'Back then, you were like a child abandoned by his parents, desperate to prove his worth.'}
{2: '???', 3: 'You were only accepting what was happening to you, even when they were consequences of your choice.'}
{2: '???', 3: 'You even accepted the specialized Inver-Device right out of the gate without inquiring what it does.'}
{2: 'Chrome', 3: 'Is... is that so?', 4: '1'}
{3: 'Chrome is about to say something else when the door to the laboratory opens with a bang.'}
{2: '???', 3: "Oh, it's over? Here's the person you've been waiting for."}
{3: 'Asimov enters with a serious expression. His hair looks even messier than usual as if it has been ravaged in a fit of frustration.'}
{3: 'Finding Chrome next to the researcher, Asimov pauses for a second before reverting to his usual calmness.'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Asimov', 3: 'Made up your mind?', 4: '2'}
{3: 'Asimov takes over the file from the researcher, reading through it with furrowed brows.'}
{2: 'Asimov', 3: '...Pretty much what I expected.', 4: '2'}
{2: 'Chrome', 3: 'Will it work?', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Asimov', 3: 'The optimizations will work. The problem is still the specialized part of the specialized frame.', 4: '2'}
{2: 'Asimov', 3: 'You already know the theories and the risks of the project.', 4: '2'}
{2: 'Chrome', 3: "I'm here, which means I'm ready for the price.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Asimov', 3: "I'm afraid it isn't that simple... There will be many unexpected complications.", 4: '2'}
{2: 'Asimov', 3: "Anyway, let's start with a virtual connection. The frame is still a prototype, but we'll see how much your M.I.N.D. deviates for now.", 4: '2'}
{2: 'Asimov', 3: "I'll get the equipment ready. Wait here.", 4: '2'}
{3: 'With that, Asimov goes back through the door, mumbling to himself.'}
{2: '???', 3: "I'll leave you to it, then."}
{2: '???', 3: 'The adaptation and the adjustment of the new frame will be done by Asimov in the future. Remember to cooperate, yeah?'}
{2: '???', 3: 'What? Do you want me to do it?'}
{2: '???', 3: "Unfortunately for you, I'm sick of this life here already. I'm turning into a Construct tomorrow! You'll soon find my name on the list of deployment."}
{2: '???', 3: "...I'm kidding. I can't do it because the only person who knows the ins and outs of the specialized frame is the Chief Technician."}
{2: '???', 3: "Plus... I did my test long ago. I'll never become a Construct."}
{2: '???', 3: "So I'm staying right where I am until the end of the war or the end of my life."}
{2: '???', 3: "Don't think that it's made my job easier. I'm still plenty busy right now."}
{2: '???', 3: "After all, we're getting volunteer applications outside of the usual Construct program sometimes."}
{2: '???', 3: 'Perhaps... something is changing.'}
{2: '???', 3: "Regardless, I believe that you are the planet's future."}
{3: 'Looking at the blue planet outside the window, the researcher subtly smiles.'}
{3: 'If there are sparks, then there are those who light them.'}
{3: "Even today, someone still believes that Constructs, born from bloodshed and sacrifices, are humanity's future."}
{1: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/BgStory16.jpg'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Asimov', 3: 'The connection device is calibrated. Are you ready?', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Chrome', 3: 'Please begin.', 4: '2'}
{3: "Following Asimov's instructions, Chrome connects the connection cable to the back of his neck."}
{2: 'Asimov', 3: 'I have to remind you that even if this is just a virtual connection, it might still affect your M.I.N.D. stability.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Asimov', 3: "Don't get careless. Eject if anything happens.", 4: '1'}
{3: 'In the next second, Chrome falls into a data stream.'}
{1: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgCg/Cgqz2403.jpg'}
{3: 'His M.I.N.D. stability hovers around the threshold in the virtual connection. Any fluctuation will result in deviation.'}
{3: 'Chrome keeps his eyes closed until the impact and dizziness from the first connection pass before slowly opening his eyes.'}
{3: 'He is standing in a space constructed from erroneous data. Alarms glowing in red float in the air all over the place.'}
{3: 'This is what happens to his M.I.N.D. after connecting with the specialized frame, a situation that can only be described as "tricky."'}
{3: 'Just like puzzle pieces trying to randomly match with one another or a yarn ball all tangled up, all kinds of information jumble together here.'}
{3: 'There are disorderly memories, echoing raves, and nightmares yet to show up.'}
{3: '"What a waste of time."'}
{3: '"I\'m disappointed in you."'}
{3: '"What can good grades and being a Chief do if he fails the connection test? He\'ll never be a commandant."'}
{3: '"They\'re no longer deployable."'}
{3: "For a moment, the massive amount of information overwhelms Chrome's senses. Like opening Pandora's box, unignorable emotions from his fragmented memories flood over him."}
{3: 'The pain starts to eat away at his brain and takes over his mind.'}
{2: 'Asimov', 3: "The adaptation rate is too low—your M.I.N.D. is overloading! You're showing signs of deviation already. I'm disconnecting you in five seconds!"}
{3: 'Holding his trembling hand, Chrome gives a wry smile.'}
{3: 'If this is what happens on a virtual connection, it is quite possible that he will immediately deviate before he can adapt to the new frame at this state.'}
{2: 'Chrome', 3: "...This doesn't look good."}
{3: 'Chrome frowns, trying to stabilize and sort the chaotic data in his M.I.N.D. to no effect.'}
{2: 'Chrome', 3: '...Is this the problem that a specialized frame faces?'}
{2: 'Chrome', 3: 'This will be a difficult battle.'}
{1: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/BgStory16.jpg'}
{3: 'Having disconnected from the virtual connection, Chrome opens his eyes.'}
{3: 'Asimov is standing in front of a screen, going over the data from the connection with furrowed brows.'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Chrome', 3: 'How is it, Asimov?', 4: '2'}
{2: 'Asimov', 3: 'Expectedly bad.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Asimov', 3: 'As I expected, the adaptation will come with a lot of problems.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Asimov', 3: 'Fully adapting to the frame will take a very long time of adjustment.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Asimov', 3: "I'd be lying if I say the adjustment process is easy.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Asimov', 3: 'Are you ready for it?', 4: '1'}
{3: 'Without hesitation, Chrome nods.'}
{2: 'Chrome', 3: 'I was ready long before I stepped through the door.', 4: '2'}
